en.title: Grid Lock

Written by: David Dionisio
Music from: Kevin Macleod
en.hintTooltip: Press this button to show hints.
en.dragItemTip: Drag the item to the designated point.
en.lesson1_0: The coordinate plane is a two-dimensional surface made up of two lines: horizontal and vertical.
en.lesson1_1: First, let's look at the horizontal line: The X-axis.
en.lesson1_2: From the origin, the positive X values go right.
en.lesson1_3: ...and the negative X values go left.
en.lesson1_4: Now, the vertical line: The Y-axis.
en.lesson1_5: From the origin, the positive Y values go up.
en.lesson1_6: ...and the positive Y values go down.
en.lesson1_7: When you pair the X and Y values together, you get a point on the coordinate plane.
en.lesson1_8: The point is where the two axis lines intersect. Watch the two values change as Robert moves.
en.lesson1_9: Next up, we will go over the quadrants.
en.lesson2_0: The quadrants are the four sections of the coordinate plane.
en.lesson2_1: As you can see, the quadrants are divided by the X and Y axis from the origin.
en.lesson2_2: Each one determines the sign values of the X and Y: positive or negative.
en.lesson2_3: Now let's help Robert move from Quadrant 1 to Quadrant 2.
en.lesson2_6: Excellent! Now we are ready to patch the system!
